DOC.brief_summary: Insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF)-1 is an important neuromyotrophic hormone. Disregulation of this hormone has been reported to influence the genesis of cognitive impairment and dementia in the elderly patients. We analyzed the possible link between IGF-1 and risk of Sarcopenia and Mortality in a cohort of elder patients with cognitive impairment.
DOC.brief_title: IGF-1, Sarcopenia and Mortality: a Cohort Study in Patient With Cognitive Impairment
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of cognitive impairment (MMSE < 24) Age > 65 ys Diagnosis of pancreatic disorders Diagnosis of acromegaly Diagnosis of GHrelated disorders Recent bone fractures or immobility before the enrollment (3 months) Cancer
